newsitem.title: USA: NetDynamics says Netscape to feature its tools.
newsitem.headline: NetDynamics says Netscape to feature its tools.

text.p: NetDynamics Inc said Netscape Communications Corp will feature the NetDynamics development studio and application server in a Netscape SuiteTools line to be unveiled separately today.

The NetDynamics product allows large institutions and corporations to develop and deliver applications across the organization based on the Java software technologies invented and being developed by Sun Microsystems Inc.
The Java-based tool enables organizations to create their own Web applications dynamically tied to databases, providing the opportunity to mix old and newer applications.

"Under the terms of the agreement between the companies, Netscape will resell NetDynamics as the preferred Java enterprise database application tool to its corporate customer base," the private, Menlo-Park based company said.
NetDynamics said Netscape would sell the product through its direct sales force and distribution channels worldwide.
The company said NetDynamics will also be highlighted in the Netscape DevEdge on-line Internet site for developers.
NetDynamics also announced support for the Netscape ONE open network environment as a prefered platform for developing Internet and Intranet applications.
The software tool products help customers develop new applications for the World Wide Web, including electronic commerce and real time information distribution.

"We have focused our company and products on 'Web- volutionizing' businesses -- using the Web to directly impact the bottom line," NetDynamics President and Chief Executive Zack Rinat said in a statement.
NetDynamics has raised a total of $7 million from its backers, including the venture capital firms Hummer Winblad and U.S. venture partners, along with Intel Corp.
"This is a huge boost because of the dramatic increase in presence with the corporate customers," a spokeswoman said.
NetDynamics is on its fourth generation of products, and says it has in the last six months gained 250 new Fortune 1000 customers, the spokeswoman said.
